Topic.Title: 5 year old shoots 2 year old sister...

Message.Msg: ...“Indeed Echo fails to report the whole story…It seems to me this is a far more perfect example of how not to be a parent.” – t.bfine There is no question the parents bear some responsibility. The story said that the rifle was sitting in the corner of the room, but they “didn’t know it was loaded.” Sane people don’t store any type of weapon in “the corner of the room”. Sane people also don’t buy .22 caliber rifles for five year olds. Just as importantly, sane people don’t start companies to market pink and blue actual rifles (not those B.B. guns“that’ll put your eye out”), but real small game rifles – to children of any age. Obviously, the entire marketing plan of multiple colors with cartoon-like sounding names is to attract the same market of youth who like Jiminy Crickett and Chip and Dale. And, t.bfine, sane people don’t have the misguided need to have their extremist political opinion necessitate that they defend any company that would design guns for kids, and target (pun intended) that market in another callous example of free market personal greed for profit. You should be ashamed for doing so. What next? And this just in… Coming Soon to a Kid Near You 5/2/13 - Routers, Pilton, MA Due to the overwhelming success of their product line of rifles for children, Keetone Sporting Arms of Pilton, MA has introduced its new line of weapons for children to debut in the fall of 2013, just in time for hunting season. The new products will come in a variety of brilliant colors, with many having names derived from cooperative marketing deals with Disnee*, Loonie Tunes and other cross marketing opportunities The first promotional product is designed to attract youngsters to the new products, with a free miniature switch-blade knife being included with any large box of Cap’n Crunch cereal. McDonalds will follow suit with a line of Ninja throwing knives and nunchucks included with all Kids Meals. The main product line will follow soon after. Being featured in an all-out blitzkrieg of advertisements on Nickleodeon and The Kartune Network will be such kid-friendly staples as Brass Knuckles for Babies, Carbines for Children, Knives for Kids, Grenades for Grandchildren, Thompsons for Toddlers. There will also be a line of fully-automatic weapons entitled Assault Rifles for Adolescents, which will be adorned with famous cartoon characters, including Dopie and Goofy, as a tribute to both the cartoons in which they appeared, as well as the NRA and other fools who encourage, inspire and permit this kind of nonsense to go on. *All companies appearing in this work are fictitious. Any resemblance to real persons, living or dead, is purely coincidental - except one. Oh, and t.bfine.

Topic.Title: 5 year old shoots 2 year old sister...

Message.Msg: Recently a young women from our church gave a personal testimonial. In her story she talked about her young daughter Alice Anne. She said that Alice Anne was the love of her life and her daddy's little angel. She talked about the day that she and Alice Anne were home making cookies together. How her big brother Ricky was asked to let the dog out in the back yard. How Ricky had left the sliding back door open just a crack. How she heard the family dog barking and barking in the back yard, which she said she found annoying. How she went to the back door to let the dog in, and saw the dog racing around the swimming pool. How she went out to the swimming pool and found Alice Anne laying face down in the shallow end. How no amount of resuscitation from herself or the EMTs would bring little Alice Anne back to life. How she blamed herself for her moment of inattention and how she and Alice Anne's daddy would never be able to have the same relationship that they had had before the death of little Alice Anne. How she blamed God for taking away her little angel. How she asked God to forgive her for being a bad mother. How only through the grace of God was she able to make it through the day, and continue to live at all. How only through the grace of God was she given a second chance by the birth of her new little angel Sarah Anne. Yes my friends sometimes people make little mistakes that have big consequences, and I am sure that there is a federal law in there somewhere that would have saved little Alice Anne's life. But maybe, just maybe, it is just enough to try and make it through life doing your best to do the right thing, loving one another, forgiving one another when we don't make the mark, and praising God in all that we do. "In your heart you know he is right." The Frogg

Topic.Title: Meanwhile, T is quietly sneaking up on 38...

Message.Msg: At the time I posted yesterday, T was almost at 38. That's a buck shy of 39 Beau. To me, the 39 close was artificial. In the final hour or so, it popped from the high 38's to finish at 39. A lot of that last 1/2 point increase was most likely in anticipation of a better than what we got report the following morning. To my way of thinking, the stock was somewhat fairly priced around 38.75. There were buys yesterday at 38. Considering the report was disappointing, we were less than a dollar away from 38.75. Regardless of all the numbers, T held up and recovered decently from the low 36 range where it traded post-report. Today's action does not look as promising as yesterday, but that's the way it goes. But for the the record, i am a long term holder. daily fluctuations don't cause me to lose sleep. Over 30 years of owning it and no regrets. it has served me well. How about sharing your thoughts.

Topic.Title: Cost savings Idea - Eliminate the Border Patrol

Message.Msg: None of the pols have enforced the law. I picked cotton in Tahoka, TX in 1949. I got $2.00 per hundred lbs. to start. They flooded the area with Mexicans and the price dropped to .75 cents per hundred. All the Americans left the fields, Black and White. I was lucky, I found a job in power line construction. The price of cotton didn't drop. Obviously the large farmers made more money though.

I burned many paper shotgun shells because they had swelled from moisture, they would explode.

Message.Msg: ...OH MY - WHAAAT .. ECHO critical of someone ELSE for posting a NON-STOCK message on a "stock message board" – jon boy Okay, jon, you’ve proven repetitively that you can neither spell nor write. It would now appear that you are hell-bent on proving that you also cannot read. Here’s how it works, son. You are presently at the stage where you are attempting to sound out the words, syllable by syllable. (I might add, you are doing a splendid job.) Next you must learn to string all those syllables together so they flow smoothly. Having mastered the sound of the word, you then must put many of them together to form a cognitive thought – without – and please pay attention, because this gets harder, particularly for you – without pausing inextricably for a useless series or commas, quotation marks, exclamation points and girly emoticons. Assuming that you get that far, (and we all have our doubts), the really difficult part then ensues…reading for comprehension. To simplify all this for you, in response to your comment above, I’ll rephrase my point from this: “BTW, that's a really smart thing to be doing on a stock message board - advocating for an armed posse of vigilante fools to take the law into their own hands.” To this: Same sentence, delete “stock”…meaning it had nothing at all to do with content on any specific message board. Of course you would also have had to interpret “smart” as a facetious knock on fools like you who encourage law-abiding citizens to resort to armed vigilantism when they don’t get their own way…and then decipher on your own, that perhaps that isn’t the brightest thing to do. Got that now, jon? Fortunately for you, there will not be a quiz later. Now I assume you had no difficulty comprehending the sentence that followed that one, did you? “You guys are absolute clowns.”

Topic.Title: Dang I left .56 on the table selling T

Message.Msg: Can't recall my last post, but if you become agitation-free, all is good. I agree that dividends are still the way to go unless circumstances change. Depending on age, goals, income, expenses and a whole slew of other factors, everyone has to tailor their planning accordingly. Financial planning is not a one size fits all as you know. Today was a disappointment compared to yesterday. How can a -100 Dow day result in a decent gain and today a +100 gain produces nothing? No news on anything I have read, so the past 48 hours fades into trading history with nothing to explain it...
